Detailed Description

A container which holds overlap relationship connections between two BoxLevels.

MappingConnector * SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector::createLocalTranspose (  )  const [virtual]

Create and return this MappingConnector's transpose, assuming that all relationships are local (no remote neighbors).

If any remote neighbor is found an unrecoverable assertion is thrown.

Non-periodic relationships in are simply reversed to get the transpose relationship. For each periodic relationship we create a periodic relationship incident from the unshifted head neighbor to the shifted base neighbor. This is because all relationships must be incident from a real (unshifted) Box.

Reimplemented from SAMRAI::hier::Connector.

References SAMRAI::hier::Connector::convertHeadWidthToBase(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::doLocalTransposeWork(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getBase(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getConnectorWidth(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getHead(), and MappingConnector().

MappingConnector * SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector::createTranspose (  )  const [virtual]

Create and return this MappingConnector's transpose.

Similar to createLocalTranspose(), but this method allows non-local edges. Global data is required, so this method is not scalable.

Reimplemented from SAMRAI::hier::Connector.

Referenced by findMappingErrors().

size_t SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector::findMappingErrors ( MappingType  map_type = UNKNOWN  )  const

Check if the MappingConnector has a valid mapping.

This function can be called prior to calling modify(). It is intended to check the MappingConnector(s) argument(s) in modify() to determine if it has a valid mapping. In other words, it checks to see if the mapping can be used in modify() without logic errors. It does no other checks.

Parameters:
[in] map_type LOCAL means assume the mapping is local. NOT_LOCAL means the mapping is not local. UNKNOWN means find out whether the map is local or not (communication required) and act accordingly.
Returns:
number of errors found.

References SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Allreduce(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::begin(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevelConnectorUtils::computeExternalParts(), createTranspose(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::end(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::format(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getBase(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::getBoxes(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::getBoxId(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::getBoxStrict(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getConnectorWidth(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::getGlobalizedVersion(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getHead(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::getMPI(), SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::getRank(), SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::getSize(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevel::hasBox(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::hasNeighborSet(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::isSpatiallyEqual(), LOCAL, MPI_INT, MPI_MAX, NOT_LOCAL, SAMRAI::tbox::perr, SAMRAI::hier::BoxContainer::realBegin(), SAMRAI::hier::BoxContainer::realEnd(), and UNKNOWN.

void SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnector::assertMappingValidity ( MappingType  map_type = UNKNOWN  )  const

Run findMappingErrors and abort if any errors are found.

Parameters:
[in] map_type LOCAL means assume the mapping is local. NOT_LOCAL means the mapping is not local. UNKNOWN means find out whether the map is local or not (communication required) and act accordingly.
